questDatabase.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questDatabase.description: I have mastered the basics. Master warned me about forbidden magic, but it sounds so promising. I think a bit of forbidden stuff can't hurt...

questDatabase.name: An awesome magic conductor
questDatabase.description: These tears, wow, I've never felt something so strong. Could it be? Could I use those to actually finallize my Silverwood wand?

questDatabase.name: An even better conductor?
questDatabase.description: More... I want mooore! There must be something even stronger than the Hydra. Something older, more ancient.

questDatabase.name: It doesn't work
questDatabase.description: I tried to combine the lich bones I had with this new wand rod. The result: A pile of ashes. It crumbled to dust within seconds. I need a better conductor. The hydra in the twilight forest has the ability to regrow an entire head! Her blood must contain a large amount of magic. I guess I need a bit of that for my next wand

Lore: It crumbled to dust within seconds...
display.Name: Lich Bone

questDatabase.name: Obsidian Rod
questDatabase.description: By using Obsidian and some earth clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Terra vis

questDatabase.name: Creating a better wand
questDatabase.description: This greatwood wand is nice, but it can only store 50 Vis. Not enough to move nodes. My tries to use Silverwood failed, but I've come across other mundane materials that I could use to make a new wand core.

questDatabase.name: More durable screws
questDatabase.description: Those stainless steel screws don't work on these rods. Due to the huge amounts of Vis those wands can carry, the screws "melt" away, somehow. I need a more durable material. I guess I will try titanium

questDatabase.name: Quartz rod
questDatabase.description: By using nether quartz and some ordo clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Ordo vis

questDatabase.name: Reed rod
questDatabase.description: By using sugar cane and some air clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Air vis

questDatabase.name: Blazing rod
questDatabase.description: By using a blaze rod and some fire clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Ignis vis

questDatabase.name: Icy rod
questDatabase.description: By using hardend ice and some aqua clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Aqua vis

questDatabase.name: Bone rod
questDatabase.description: Forbidden? Pah. I don't care about headaches. By using Bone and entropy clusters, I'm able to create an infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own perditio vis

questDatabase.name: Best wand caps ever
questDatabase.description: Of course! Thaumium! What could conduct Vis better than... A magic metal?

questDatabase.name: She let go
questDatabase.description: This blood seems pretty common, but she had advanced magic abilities. I'm sure I can use this as a conductor

questDatabase.name: Reactor material
questDatabase.description: This stuff is interesting... Maybe I can use it as wand conductor?

questDatabase.name: Centi-Vis
questDatabase.description: Many advanced machines require Vis in order to do what they're supposed to; But using a wand as some sort of battery to transfer Vis from a Node to your machine didn't work as expected. What if you could rip open a node?

questDatabase.name: Bring it home
questDatabase.description: You probably have a nice collection of bookmarked nodes. But running around to recharge your wand(s) isn't really the way an adept thaumaturge should get his required vis. Moving nodes is not that hard, but without doubt, you need something to protect them from each other

questDatabase.name: Automated wand-recharge
questDatabase.description: So you found a way to gather nodes now. What about automated wand recharge? Wouldn't that be extremely convenient?

questDatabase.name: CentiVis stuff
questDatabase.description: You totally should get yourself some CentiVis things to transport and use the Vis from stabilized nodes

questDatabase.name: The dark realm
questDatabase.description: We found the way my precious. We found it! Only need 4 tasty eyes, and some magic to open the door. The secret door, they didn't see it; Hehehe; All the time. It was there... Aaaall the time!

questDatabase.name: They see me, they watch me
questDatabase.description: Eyes. Yes. Eyes! I need eyes, my precious. Not spidery ones, no. Nasty hairy things. Don't taste good. Eldritch eyes! I will rip those from their bodies.

questDatabase.name: Really (really!) dark magic
questDatabase.description: Fools. FOOLS I say! They know nothing! This book will guide me, yes. Yes it will, my precious. It will lead us to even more power

questDatabase.name: Secrets
questDatabase.description: I can feel it. Yess. Yeeeess. We will gain more power soon. Soon! Yes. My precious. The voices gave me a hint, there is a dimension filled with unbelievable sources of magic energy. I must go there. I must! The Crimson people know the secret. I will rip them aparrrt.. They will tell me

questDatabase.name: Find the key
questDatabase.description: No, nooo! They have hidden it! Must find the keeey. Must find it! We need the tablet to open the door my precious.

questDatabase.name: The power of creation
questDatabase.description: What.. What am I doing here? Where am I?! What is this place?! Oh those headaches... (It seems that the pulsating pearl you just found cured your brain from.. something. Something old, probably some kind of trap to keep away unworthy ones)

questDatabase.name: Concentrated darkness
questDatabase.description: For some reason, you decided to infuse darkness into a seed. It appeared to be promising. For what? You don't know...

questDatabase.name: "Armor"
questDatabase.description: This new metal, it's so.. appealing. You feel comfortable while holding it, so why not get yourself some armor? What could go wrong? It sure will protect you

questDatabase.name: What could possibly go wrong?
questDatabase.description: 256 Essentia in one block! Now that is what I call storage. Does make weird sounds, but I guess it's just normal

questDatabase.name: Let's try this
questDatabase.description: Mortals. Pah. What do they know about REAL power. The voices tell me I need to focus on Alienis and Tenebrae if I want to advance. So what about food?

questDatabase.name: An appropriate weapon
questDatabase.description: My new armor needs an appropriate weapon to go along with. I should make something to fire creates of the nether at enemies!

questDatabase.name: Improved Armor; Ninja Style
questDatabase.description: Time to get some decent armor; With this, those infernal monsters won't be as much of a pain as they are now

questDatabase.name: Little helpers
questDatabase.description: A state of the art thaumaturge doesn't work anymore. He has little helpers. Golems can and will do all the things for you, just as you command them

questDatabase.name: Slightly better
questDatabase.description: Wood is somewhat better than straw. They are still to be considered weak, but an ideal little cutie for farms

questDatabase.name: Sticks and stones
questDatabase.description: will break your bones! These guys are hard as rock (Insert audience laugh here) and will protect your claim as good as possible

questDatabase.name: The best of all
questDatabase.description: Highly durable, can carry a lot of items and is to be considered the "top tier" golem. But you are sure there is more...

questDatabase.name: Essentia storage
questDatabase.description: Sure, you could just go with gazillions of jars, but it's way more convenient to store essentia in a chest or barrel. Isn't it?

questDatabase.name: The basic elements
questDatabase.description: Of course you know where and how to get the basic essentia types. Do you..?

questDatabase.name: Essentia transmission
questDatabase.description: What if.. you could send essentia from a different location to your infusion matrix? You could finally get rid of all those jars around your altar. Also, there might be an additional use for those mirrors

questDatabase.name: (Almost) automated essentia
questDatabase.description: By combining the essentia locus, the essentia mirror and an essentia aggregator, you are now able to transmit essentia from almost anywhere. Fancy essentia-storage facility incomming!

questDatabase.name: Essentia Monitoring
questDatabase.description: Manually checking your jars can be tedious, especially if you want to infuse a bunch of stuff at once. Luckily, the Essentia Locus can help you with that, as it monitors all jars that have been targeted with a crystalline eye

questDatabase.name: Cleaning the goo
questDatabase.description: As you're doing more and more infusions, you're probably tired of removing all the flux that's generated from time to time. The shovel of the purifier will help you with that task, and is a must-have

questDatabase.name: One does not simply...
questDatabase.description: ...play with magic. Be warned, those fires are dangerous to use. But who doesn't want a patch of snow in the nether?

questDatabase.name: Useful plant life
questDatabase.description: While regular plants are basically just used to make food, you wondered if you could get some.. "more special" plant life going...

questDatabase.name: Pushing the limits
questDatabase.description: Regular enchantments do have a limit, like III for Fortune. By utilizing magic, you should be able to bypass that limitation, at least a tiny bit; Eventually creating enchantments like Fortune IV. It comes with limitations, but your book shall tell you more about those

questDatabase.name: Enchanting like a pro
questDatabase.description: Finally, a device where you can actually choose which enchantment you want to have. Powered by vis, it can create the most powerful combinations one could imagine

questDatabase.name: Crying obsidian
questDatabase.description: Quite confusing name, but this might come in handy for some cases. By placing 2 on top of each other, you're able to set your respawn point to that location, without the need for a bed. It's up to you to imagine the possibilities...
